intro: Lauradia capillaris, commonly known as the silver hair grass, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Africa. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its fine, silver-hairy leaves. The plant typically grows in wet or marshy environments, thriving in moist soils. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are usually clustered in dense inflorescences. Lauradia capillaris is often used in traditional medicine and as a ornamental plant due to its delicate appearance.
